ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
ASAP (Atomic SimulAtion Program or As Soon As Possible) is a
package for large-scale molecular dynamics within the Atomic
Simulation Environment (ASE).  It implements a number of 'classical'
potentials, most importantly the Effective Medium Theory, and also the
mechanisms for domain-decomposition of the atoms.
about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale molecular dynamics (MD) within the Atomic Simulation Environment.

about.description:
ASAP (Atomic SimulAtion Program or As Soon As Possible) is a
package for large-scale molecular dynamics within the Atomic
Simulation Environment (ASE).  It implements a number of 'classical'
potentials, most importantly the Effective Medium Theory, and also the
mechanisms for domain-decomposition of the atoms.
about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale molecular dynamics (MD) within the Atomic Simulation Environment.

name: asap

about.description:
ASAP (Atomic SimulAtion Program or As Soon As Possible) is a
package for large-scale molecular dynamics within the Atomic
Simulation Environment (ASE).  It implements a number of 'classical'
potentials, most importantly the Effective Medium Theory, and also the
mechanisms for domain-decomposition of the atoms.
about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale molecular dynamics (MD) within the Atomic Simulation Environment.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "asap" %}
{% set version = "3.12.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/asap3/asap3-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b6c03c790ba4c9f0d231659078c26ce8193fa21314bf2fe4adaa7899d5cd9dbe

build:
  number: 5
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  skip: true  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
  host:
    - numpy
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - ase
    - python
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}

test:
  imports:
    - asap3

about:
  home: https://pypi.org/project/asap3
  license: LGPL-3.0-only
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - LICENSE.LESSER
  summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale molecular dynamics (MD) within the Atomic Simulation Environment.

  description: |
    ASAP (Atomic SimulAtion Program or As Soon As Possible) is a
    package for large-scale molecular dynamics within the Atomic
    Simulation Environment (ASE).  It implements a number of 'classical'
    potentials, most importantly the Effective Medium Theory, and also the
    mechanisms for domain-decomposition of the atoms.

  doc_url: https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/asap
  dev_url: https://gitlab.com/asap/asap

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - Anthchirp
